skill.name: edn-analyzer
skill.description: Deep EDN template analyzer for Logseq database graphs. Analyzes template structure, counts classes/properties, finds orphaned items, checks quality, and compares variants. Use when analyzing template files, finding issues, or comparing different template versions.
skill.summary: Deep EDN template analyzer for Logseq database graphs. Analyzes template structure, counts classes/properties, finds orphaned items, checks quality, and compares variants.
skill.author: C0ntr0lledCha0s

security_audit.summary: Evaluated 216 static findings across 4 files (3,190 lines). All findings are false positives: external_commands (151) are documentation examples of bash scripts, network URLs (5) are documentation references, and cryptographic algorithm flags misidentify Clojure EDN keywords like :db.cardinality/one. This is a read-only EDN template analysis skill using Read/Grep/Glob tools.

content.user_title: Analyze EDN templates for Logseq graphs
content.value_statement: EDN template analysis is time-consuming when done manually. The edn-analyzer skill provides automated structure analysis, quality checks, and comparison features for Logseq database graph templates. It identifies orphaned items, validates structure, and generates actionable reports.
actual_capabilities: Analyze EDN template structure including classes, properties, and their relationships
Find orphaned classes and properties missing required parent references
Compare template variants (Full, CRM, Research, Content, Events) and identify differences
Generate statistics on property types, cardinality distribution, and module sizes
Validate EDN structure and check for duplicate IDs or missing required fields
Map class hierarchies and property-to-class relationships across modules
limitations: Does not modify or fix template issues - only reports findings and suggests fixes
Cannot analyze templates that are not in valid EDN format
Performance may slow with very large templates (15K+ lines)
Does not execute Clojure code or evaluate EDN expressions

use_cases.title: Quality assurance for template development
use_cases.description: Run automated checks on new or modified templates to find issues before deployment. Identify orphaned classes, duplicate IDs, and structural problems.
use_cases.target_user: Template developers and Logseq power users

use_cases.title: Compare template variants
use_cases.description: Compare different template builds (Full, CRM, Research, etc.) to understand what classes and properties are included or excluded in each variant.

use_cases.title: Audit existing template health
use_cases.description: Perform comprehensive audits of large template repositories to identify bloat, unbalanced modules, and potential reorganization opportunities.

prompt_templates.title: Basic template statistics
prompt_templates.prompt:
Analyze the template at [FILE_PATH] and show me:
- Total classes and properties
- Property type distribution (default, node, date, url, number)
- Cardinality breakdown (:one vs :many)
- Any quality issues found
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick overview of template contents and structure

prompt_templates.title: Find orphaned items
prompt_templates.prompt:
Find all orphaned classes and properties in [FILE_PATH]. For each orphaned item, show:
- The item name and ID
- File location (file and line number)
- Suggested fix with example code
prompt_templates.scenario: Quality check for missing parent references

prompt_templates.title: Compare template variants
prompt_templates.prompt:
Compare [TEMPLATE_A] and [TEMPLATE_B]. Show me:
- Size comparison (classes, properties, KB)
- Items unique to each template
- Module-level differences
- What use case each template is optimized for

prompt_templates.title: Module health analysis
prompt_templates.prompt:
Analyze module balance in [TEMPLATE_PATH]. For each module, show:
- Class and property counts
- Ratio of properties per class
- Whether the module is appropriately sized or needs reorg
- Specific suggestions for problematic modules
prompt_templates.scenario: Identifying architectural issues in template organization

output: CRM Includes: base/, person/, organization/, common/
Size Reduction: 40% smaller, optimized for customer relationships

best_practices: Use specific file paths in prompts to get accurate line numbers for issues
Request both statistics and issues to get a complete picture of template health
When comparing variants, ask for module-level breakdowns to understand exclusions
Follow up on quality reports by asking for fix suggestions for each issue
anti_patterns: Asking for analysis without specifying a file path
Expecting the skill to modify templates - it only analyzes and reports
Using vague requests like 'analyze everything' instead of specific analysis types
Assuming the skill can execute Clojure code or run database queries

faq.question: What file formats does this skill analyze?
faq.answer: This skill analyzes EDN (Extensible Data Notation) files, specifically Logseq database template files that contain :properties and :classes maps with Logseq-specific keywords like :db/cardinality and :logseq.property/type.

faq.question: Can this skill fix issues it finds?
faq.answer: No, the skill only identifies and reports issues like orphaned classes, missing fields, or duplicate IDs. It provides suggestions for fixes but does not modify files. You can use the suggestions to make changes manually or with other skills.

faq.question: How long does analysis take for large templates?
faq.answer: Most analyses complete in under 30 seconds for templates up to 15,000 lines. Very large templates (20K+ lines) may take slightly longer. The skill uses efficient parsing and focuses on specific analysis types when requested.

faq.question: What is the difference between property types?
faq.answer: Property types indicate how values are stored: :default is plain text, :node links to other pages, :date stores dates, :url stores links, and :number stores numeric values. This affects how Logseq handles and displays the property.

faq.question: How do I compare my custom template against a standard one?
faq.answer: Provide paths to both template files and ask to compare them. The skill will show class and property counts, unique items in each, and module-level differences to help identify what your custom template includes or excludes.

faq.question: What are orphaned classes and why do they matter?
faq.answer: Orphaned classes lack a :build/class-parent reference (except Thing and Agent which are root classes). They break the inheritance hierarchy, meaning they cannot inherit shared properties from parent classes. This can lead to inconsistent data modeling.
